results.title: The World: A Television History. Ep. 01. Human Origins
results.creator_credit: Taylor Downing, Bricomin Films, Channel Four, Goldcrest TV and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The World: A Television History”.
This episode looks at the origins of mankind; where we come from, and how we differ from other forms of life on earth. It traces our descent from apes in trees, to land apes who stood erect, to our large brain development 500,000 years ago. Since that time no brain development has occurred, only changes in appearance to suit the different climates that existed after the ice-age. 10,000 years ago humans reached a social and cultural level which put them far above other animal life. Based on The Times atlas of world history.

results.title: The World: A Television History
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Barton, Bricomin Films, Channel Four, Goldcrest and Network Television
results.brief_description: A series of 26 videos presenting a history of humankind from its origins to the shaping of the modern world. The series looks at significant developments and great historical achievements in culture, science, technology, war, society, religion and all aspects of man’s progress. Based on the Times atlas of world history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Barton, Bricomin Films, Channel Four, Goldcrest and Network Television

results.title: The World tree: A scandinavian creation myth (K)_
results.brief_description: An art film which depicts the Scandinavian myth of Voluspa involving the opposing forces of fire and ice, the frost giant, the ice cows and the gods who created everything on Earth, including the world tree which formed a bridge between the gods and the universe they had created.

results.title: The World parade: America's wonderlands
results.brief_description: An American travelogue showing many of America’s famous national parks including the Rocky Mountains National Park and Yellowstone. Also features other areas of interest such as the magnificent Niagara Falls and the Yosemite Falls and glimpses of Colorado, Oregon, Utah, Arizona, California and New York.

results.title: The World of the molecule
results.brief_description: Nobel Prize winner Professor Hermann Staudinger speaks about macro molecules. In the age of mass consumption no branch of the chemical industry has experienced a boom such as that if the production of plastic.
